str2: Finally, from now on, henceforth, beyond that. Neuter singular of the same as loipoy; something remaining.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: Apparently from ereo; to interrogate; by implication, to request.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: From para and kaleo; to call near, i.e. Invite, invoke.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
From peri and pateo; to tread all around, i.e. Walk at large; figuratively, to live, deport oneself, follow.
Adverb from the base of pou; an interrogative particle of manner; in what way?; also as exclamation, how much!
To please, with the idea of willing service rendered to others; hence almost: I serve. Probably from airo; to be agreeable.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
According to the manner in which, in the degree that, just as, as. From kata and hos; just as, that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From para and lambano; to receive near, i.e. Associate with oneself; by analogy, to assume an office; figuratively, to learn.
Gen: from; dat: beside, in the presence of; acc: alongside of.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
According to the manner in which, in the degree that, just as, as. From kata and hos; just as, that.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From peri and pateo; to tread all around, i.e. Walk at large; figuratively, to live, deport oneself, follow.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From perissos; to superabound, be in excess, be superfluous; also to cause to superabound or excel.
More, rather. Neuter of the comparative of the same as malista; more) or rather.
